fields.description:
h3. Summary

User unable to differentiate between Original Estimate and ΣOriginal Estimate in russian
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change user profile language to Russian
 # Create a jira project
 # Add Time Tracking
 # Create a ticket with Original estimate
 # Save the ticket
 # Go to issue navigator and click column
 # Find for Первоначальная оценка (It means Original Estimate)

h3. Actual Results

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

User should be able to see the following:
 Первоначальная оценка
 Σ Первоначальная оценка
fields.summary: Unable to differentiate Original Estimate in russian

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Quick search with Japanese keyword didn't work as Japanese customers expected.

h3. Environment

* JIRA Cloud v1000.482.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Confirm if *Indexing Language* is set to JIRA's default (*English - Aggressive Stemming*)
# Create an issue whose summary is "あいうえお"
# Input a keyword "あいうえお" in the quick search field

h3. Expected Results

The issue should be shown on the quick search as the candidate.
Otherwise, the quick search shouldn't show "No matching search results" error.

h3. Actual Results

The quick search didn't show any candidate with a keyword which contains more than one character like "あい", "あいう", "あいうえ", "あいうえお" and "No matching search results" error was shown as follows.
 !not-searchable.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

* The root cause seems to be a spec of Lucene index according to the following facts
*- The issue was shown as the candidate when inputting a keyword which has only one character like "あ" instead of "あいうえお"
 !searchable.png|thumbnail! 
*- The issue was shown when inputting a keyword which contains two characters like "あい" in case that we set *Chinese/Japanese/Korean* as *Indexing Language* instead
* Customers that had a temporary fix applied will see this problem again unfortunately. Please follow the workaround to perform searches in future.

h3.Workaround

Press return / enter to perform the search and results will be returned.
fields.summary: Quick search with Japanese keywords

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clicking any link on issue statistics (Project summary) takes you to a blank search. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select projects from projects drop-down. 
# Switch view to statistics.
# Click any of the links All Issues, Unresolved, ect and it will take you to blank search. 

h3. Expected Results

It should return the associated JQL search results. 

h3. Actual Results

It takes you to a blank search.
fields.summary: Issue statistic links on Project Summary returning blank results.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a customer tries to attach a file to an issue from the edit issue page, an error is returned: "An internal error has occurred.  Please contact your administrator.”. This bug is similar to existing ticket: JRA-61291.  Attaching a file using any method except those mentioned in this ticket and in JRA-61291 will work without issue.

 

Clicking on the Edit option in the issue on gadget opens the edit issue page instead of dialog.
h3. Environment

JIRA 1000.824.3
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard
 # Add a gadget e.g. Filter Results
 # Hover over the issue listed in the gadget to reveal the menu (...)
 !Screen Shot 2017-03-17 at 3.51.15 PM.png|width=555,height=205!
 # Click “Edit"
 # “Drop” the file, or “browse” and select the file
 # Error message: “An internal error has occurred.  Please contact your administrator.”
 !Screen Shot 2017-03-17 at 2.28.17 PM.png|width=598,height=178!

h3. Expected Results

The file is uploaded and attached to the issue.
h3. Actual Results

Error message: “An internal error has occurred. Please contact your administrator.” (see screenshot above)
h3. Notes
 * Multiple attachment file formats and sizes affected
 * Multiple browsers affected

h3. Workaround

Search for the issue: “Issues > Search for issues” and upload the attachment.
fields.summary: Attaching files via the edit issue returns an error message

fields.description:
h3. Summary
{{fixVersion is Empty}} doesn't return issues without fixVersion that were created while the field fixVersion was hidden

h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.5.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Hide fixVersion field
# Create an issue that doesn't have fixVersion
# Search for issues with empty fixVersion, the created issue won't be shown

However the steps below works as expected:
# Create an issue that doesn't have fixVersion
# Hide fixVersion field
# Search for issues with empty fixVersion, the created issue will be shown

h3. Expected Results
The issues without fixVersion should be shown.

h3. Actual Results
Issues created without fixVersion that were created while fixVersion was hidden aren't returned by the search
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
On boards that use fixVersion on sub-filter, users can remove it
fields.summary: The search fixVersion is Empty doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

First of all this issue is very similar to this one:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41646

However, I wasn't able to tell whether they have the same root cause or not, as this refers to the different fields and timezones. If this is the case, feel free to close this bug as duplicate and we can update the other one.

When a user has an instance in timezone America/Montevideo, when setting a date, the actual date the user sees is one day behind.

This is likely caused by the Daylight Saving Time. This was replicated on November/25/2015 (not on DST).

This cannot be replicated by using the user's timezone in the profile page. This setting must be the system setting to cause this problem.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a JIRA Cloud instance with system timezone set to America/Montevideo
# Create an issue
# Set the due date for this issue

h3. Expected Results
The due date displays the date the user entered.

h3. Actual Results
The date is one day behind.
 
h3. Notes
This is stored in the database for due date:
{noformat}
2015-11-27 00:00:00-02
{noformat}
If we convert to GMT-3, we get '2015-11-26 23:00:00-03', which explains why the previous day is displayed.

This bug may be related to this:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-45667


h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Date fields are showing one day behind the date originally set date when system timezone is Montevideo

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Dashboards with the JIRA Issues Calendar gadget cause the user's browser to become unresponsive.
h3. Workaround

A fix is currently being prepared and will be rolled out to instances once it's available. Prior to that, Support can manually delete the gadget from the affected dashboard(s) if a support ticket is raised containing the specific dashboards that are affected.

*OR*
h3. Workaround in Firefox**
 # Access JIRA affected dashboard/s in Firefox.
 # A pop up message will be shown for broken script.
 # Click stop script to stop it from keep loading which will enable further navigation.
 # Edit the dashboard and remove JIRA Issues Calendar gadget from the dashboard.

This workaround only applicable to dashboard creator.

Thanks to [~adrian.sabo2061406965] for this workaround.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Calendar gadget causing dashboard to become unresponsive in browser

fields.description:
When viewing issues in a JIRA project with the default filters, the "Switch Filters" menu does not function properly.  The filter links don't work, and the menu pop-up fails to appear.

Using Google Chrome:

# Go to a project page in JIRA
# Click "Issues" on left nav bar
# "Open Issues" is the default filter view
# Click "Switch Filters" drop down menu and select a new filter (e.g. "Reported By Me")
# *Issue 1: Filter does not change to Reported By Me, it changes to All Issues.*
# *Issue 2: Clicking "Switch Filters" drop down menu fails to appear.*
fields.summary: "Switch Filters" menu links don't work and pop-up menu stops popping

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Error when creating an issue if the Create transition has JMWE post-function and the add-on is disabled/uninstalled

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JMWE add-on
# Add post-function on the *Create* transition in the workflow
# Publish the draft of the workflow
# Disable the JMWE add-on 
# Try to create an issue


h3. Expected Results
No error is shown and the issue is created


h3. Actual Results
*Error message:*
{code}
We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file.
{code}

*Still the issue is created*
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Ignore the error message
fields.summary: Error when creating an issue if the JMWE add-on is uninstalled/disabled and there is an post-function from it on the create transition

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If an issue is commented during a transition the 'Issue Commented Event' is not triggered.

h3. Environment (found on these version but could be on previous releases)
* JIRA 7.1.0-OD-01 
* JIRA Cloud v 1000.621.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a notification scheme that only sends alerts for the 'Issue Commented' event type
# Comment on an issue (notification should be sent)
# Comment on an issue via a transition screen

h3. Expected Results
Notification is sent.

h3. Actual Results
No notification is sent

h3.Workaround
Ensure the notification event that is triggered by the transition will notify the same groups/roles/individuals as the issue commented event.
fields.summary: Issue commented event not fired from transition

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Internal Server Error when calling the /rest/auth/1/session REST API endpoint as described in [JIRA REST API Example Cookie based Authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+REST+API+Example+-+Cookie-based+Authentication]

h3. Environment
JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run {noformat}
curl -D- -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"username":"USER_NAME", "password":"PASSWORD" }' -X POST https://INSTANCE_NAME.atlassian.net/rest/auth/1/session 
{noformat}


h3. Expected Results
The session information is returned in the REST response

h3. Actual Results
Error 500 is returned instead:
{noformat}
HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
Server: Atlassian Proxy/0.5.38
ATL-vTM-Backend-Time: 1036
Content-Type: text/html
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=315360000; includeSubDomains; preload
Date: Wed, 25 Jan 2017 12:46:39 GMT
ATL-vTM-Time: 1196
ETag: "5886e223-945"
Connection: close
Content-Length: 2373
ATL-vTM-Queue-Time: 0

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <meta charset="utf-8">
        <meta name="description" content="">
        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
        <title>Atlassian Cloud Notifications - Page Unavailable</title>
    ....
....
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
It doesn't matter if you use the username or the email address to authenticate. It just doesn't work.


h3.Workaround
You can use Basic Authentication or OAuth (you can also try to use basic auth, intercept the cookie and use it to authenticate the successive requests):
- [JIRA REST API Example - Basic Authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-apis/jira-rest-apis/jira-rest-api-tutorials/jira-rest-api-example-basic-authentication]
- [JIRA REST API Example - OAuth authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-apis/jira-rest-apis/jira-rest-api-tutorials/jira-rest-api-example-oauth-authentication]
fields.summary: Internal Server Error when calling /rest/auth/1/session REST API endpoint

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Import wizard prerequisites states that:
{quote}
<JIRA_HOME>/data/attachments directory. The contents should either have the attachments directory as the top level directory, or the project keys within the attachments directory as the top level directories.
{quote}
In the past .zip files with either attachments/ or project keys in the root level would be accepted by the importer.
Now only attachments/ directory at the root of the .zip file is accepted by the wizard.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud imports

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a backup from JIRA Cloud
# Extract the backup and run the following commands to prepare for Cloud Import:
{noformat}
7za a backup.zip activeobjects.xml entities.xml
cd data/
7za a attachments.zip attachments/
mv attachments.zip ../
cd attachments/
7za a attachments-pkeys.zip *
mv attachments/attachments-pkeys.zip ../../
{noformat}
# Go to JIRA Import Wizard: /secure/admin/StudioImportSelect!start.jspa
# Read the Prerequisites to make sure it matches the format and click Next
# Run the importer using attachments-pkeys.zip in the attachments field

h3. Expected Results
Import Wizard continues to next screen as the .zip matches the prerequisites

h3. Actual Results
The following error is displayed:
{quote}
This archive doesn't contain any valid attachments
{quote}
 
h3. Notes
Using attachments.zip created earlier succeeds


h3.Workaround
Zip attachments with the attachments/ directory at the root or get in contact with support for them to correct the directory path of already uploaded attachments to webdav.
fields.summary: JIRA import only accepts attachments/ directory as the root of the zip

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 14th July 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}

Hi everyone,

Thank you for your collective contribution to this ticket over the past 2 days. We have worked diligently to identify and resolve the root cause of this issue since late Tuesday.

We have pushed out a new version of JIRA that contains a fix for this problem and should allow your team to continue working as normal.

On the way, we have identified there are two steps required in order to resolve this issue.

# Ensure you are on the latest version of JIRA, 1000.148.3 or above (if you wish to be upgrades sooner, please [contact support|https://support.atlassian.com/customer/home].)
# After you’re on the latest version of JIRA, clear Zephyr’s cache by following the steps below:
## Manage Add-on
## General Config (Under ZEPHYR section)
## Clearing Server Cache.

If you still experience this issue after following these steps, please contact Zephyr directly through their support.

Kind Regards,
Kerrod Williams
JIRA Product Management
{panel}

h3. Status Update from 2016-07-13 05:56 p.m. GMT 00:00

Atlassian has identified the root cause of the problem - it's related to the undesired changes to the results of some REST API calls. For example a call to the issue's status will not longer return a description field in case if the status description is empty. Our development team has already implemented the code fix, and it's now rolling to all customers. A new version will be released during the next maintenance window for every customer, so all customers should get the fix in next 24 hours.

In case you can't wait till the next maintenance window for your instance please submit a case to our Support team so they plan updating your instance ahead of schedule. This action may result in JIRA unavailability for a few minutes.

h3. Summary

When adding a test case to a Zephyr Test cycle error "You do not have permission to see the specified issue" is thrown.
h5. Additional notes:
When viewing the Test Summary pages of specific projects, the page is completely blank and the following error appears in javascript console:
{code}
jquery.min.js:2 GET https://prod-play.zephyr4jiracloud.com/connect/summaryWithNoToken?projectId=10501&_=1468351986194 500 (Internal Server Error)
{code}

h3. Environment

1000.148.2. (Issue is not reproducible in previous version 1000.141.2)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In the issue screen add an issue to a test cycle
# Access the test cycle after adding it
# Error "You do not have permission to see the specified issue" is thrown in the test cycle and the test issue details are not shown.

 !Pasted_Image_12_07_16_15_51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The issue should show in the test cycle.

h3. Actual Results

No errors are found in the logs. 

h3.Workaround

Suggested workaround is to add a description to all Issue Constant fields (status, issueType, priority, resolution) that do not already have one.
fields.summary: Error is thrown in Zephyr when viewing a test cycle

h3. Summary
JIRA iOS - Can’t create issues with additional Required Fields

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* iOS 9.3.2 or Android
* JIRA iOS v1.3.3.20

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure a Project has a Required field outside of the default settings (Issue Type, Assignee, Reporter)
# On the top-right, click on the “Create Issue” square+pencil button
# Fill in all available fields, and set the issue to the Project with that extra required field
# Click on Create

h3. Expected Results
JIRA iOS should create the issue in the Project

h3. Actual Results
An Error pops up with “<Required Field> is required>”
 
h3. Notes
The following message might also appear when you're creating an issue that has "_Select List_" field types as required from the mobile app:
{quote}This issue type has fields that aren't supported yet.
We're working on this, but for now you need to create this one on desktop.{quote}

h3.Workaround
Must use the Desktop app to create the issue
fields.summary: JIRA Mobile - Can’t create issues with additional Required Fields

h3. Summary
If the assignee was changed based on a post function for example, *Copy Value From Other Field*, this change is not saved to the history, which also leads to the fact that the query:

assignee was 'some_username'
{code}
does not show the issues where '*some_username*' was an assignee. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a transition to a workflow to copy the field assignee
#*  !Change Assignee post function.png|thumbnail!  
# Transition an issue and see the assignee being changed

h3. Actual Result
There is no information in *Issue History* that the Assignee field was changed

There should be information in *Issue History* that the Assignee field was changed

{color:#333333}Thanks :){color}

h3. Summary 

A custom logo is not preserved after a seamless upgrade is done on a Cloud instance.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues created or updated via Email no longer show a placeholder for inline embedded images

h3. Environment
* 7.2.0-OD-05-023 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a Mail Server and Mail Handler per [Create Issues and Comments from Email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-779288896.html]
# Send an Email to your Mail Server with an inline embedded image

h3. Expected Results
Image is added as an attachment to the related issue and a placeholder is added to the Comment/Description indicating where the image was located
Placeholder looks like:
!ImagePlaceholder.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Image is attached to the Issue however there is no placeholder in the Comment or Description to indicate where it came from:
!EmbeddedImageExample.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
Previously, images that were embedded in an email message were shown as:
{noformat}[cid:ImageName.png@numericalstring]{noformat}

This can cause confusion if multiple users are engaging on the same issue via email and are embedding images in their messages; can't determine which image goes with what comment

Tested in:
- GMail - web client
- AirMail (Beta) - Mac client

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Issues created or updated via Email no longer show a placeholder for inline embedded images

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a Cloud backup is created on JIRA Cloud instance, using the backup manager, importing the same backup again in the same Cloud instance or another generates an 'invalid XML character (Unicode: 0xc)'.

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud JIRA 1000.245.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Step 1 create a backup on a Cloud instance
# Step 2 import the backup back in to the Cloud instance

h3. Expected Results
The import is successful 

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{noformat}
@4000000057b1dfcc16f48894 2016-08-15 20:59:06,385 Long running task: OnDemandBackup INFO sysadmin 1258x215x1 vmsodg 193.240.188.96 /rest/obm/1.0/runbackup [c.a.o.backupmanager.service.JiraBackupService] Export of logos completed in 1ms.
@4000000057b1e066047dd56c [Fatal Error] :16392:17: An invalid XML character (Unicode: 0xc) was found in the CDATA section.
@4000000057b1e06605191784 2016-08-15 21:01:40,079 http-nio-2996-exec-14 WARN sysadmin 1261x321x1 vmsodg 193.240.188.96 /secure/admin/StudioImportSelect!select.jspa [c.a.s.j.i.impl.visitor.JiraExportVisitor] There was an error parsing the entities.xml file
@4000000057b1e06605191f54 org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; lineNumber: 16392; columnNumber: 17; An invalid XML character (Unicode: 0xc) was found in the CDATA section.
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
# unzip the JIRA Cloud backup 
# clean the entities.xml with the tool at https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/removing-invalid-characters-from-xml-backups-12079.html.
# re-zip the cleaned entities.xml and the activeobjects.xml to a new zip file.
fields.summary: Backups created from JIRA Cloud generate 'invalid XML character' and fails when imported back into Cloud.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Can't add/delete gadgets on a dashboard when using IE11

h3. Environment

This bug only affects cloud version. I couldn't reproduce this bug on server version. (JIRA 7.2.3)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* *Scenario 1*
*# Click {{Add gadget}} on a dashboard
*# Select a gadget and put {{Add gadget}} button on the dialog

* *Scenario 2*
*# Try to delete a gadget from a dashboard

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to add/delete gadgets correctly as we can do them with other browsers.

h3. Actual Results

* *Scenario 1* : There is no response from JIRA when I put {{Add gadget}} button and the gadget was not added to the dashboard
!add_gadget.png|thumbnail!
* *Scenario 2* : The following error was shown
!delete_gadget.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

* As I mentioned above, I couldn't reproduce this bug with other browsers than IE

h3.Workaround

Please use other browsers instead of IE.
fields.summary: Can't add/delete gadgets on a dashboard when using IE11

fields.description:
h3. JIRA Mail Loop when attachments is over size limit.
h3. Environment
 * Secure IMAP Custom Mail Server required
 * By default, attachment size limit is 10Mb

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a Secure IMAP Mail Server configured (Gmail can be used for testing)
 # Configure a "Issue From Email" handler
 # Send a email to this handler, having a 10mb+ file attached.

h3. Expected Results
 - The issue is created but the attachment isn't uploaded to the issue.

h3. Actual Results

JIRA Creates a loop of issues
  
h3. Notes

To stop the mail loop, you might have to delete/move the email manually from the in-box
fields.summary: JIRA Mail Loop when attachments is over size limit

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users unable to receive notification when watching. Even after all watchers are enabled in the notification scheme

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Add as a watcher to a ticket
# Update ticket (have other profile or turn on "notify me")

h3. Expected Result
Able to receive email notification

h3. Actual Result
Did not receive email notification

Notification Log stops at:
{noformat}
2016-11-16 17:53:48.261805500 2016-11-16 17:53:48,261 httpclient-callbacks:thread-4 INFO      [c.a.j.notifications.impl.NotificationServiceImpl] Notification sent successfully to [joshua.purcell(joshua.purcell)] in 'iOS JIRA Development' app
{noformat}
fields.summary: Unable to recieve notification

fields.description:
For a JIRA Cloud dashboard, containing both Connect add-ons and Atlassian Gadgets, the configuration of the Connect add-ons is being deleted incorrectly.

The trigger is when configuration of one of the following Atlassian gadgets is edited and saved:
* Created vs Resolved gadget
* Two Dimensional Filter
(there may be others)

This is somehow deleting the configuration of any Connect add-ons on the dashboard.
fields.summary: Dashboard gadget configuration is being lost

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Create a Linked:" missing during project creation.

h3. Step to replicate
# Access JIRA
# Click on "Projects"
# Click on "Create Project"
# Choose a template
# Click on "Next"

h3. Expected Result
The following option should be visible:
{code}Create a Linked: 
Confluence Space{code} 

h3. Actual Result
No option to create space

h3. Workaround
# Create JIRA project and Confluence
# Go to Confluence Space Tools
# Link the JIRA project
fields.summary: Option to create linked space while creating project is missing

fields.description:
h3. Environment

Windows 8 x64, Chrome 47

*.atlassian.net instance, from System info:

JIRA Info:
Version	7.1.0-OD-05-006
Build Number	71001
Build Date	Wed Jan 13 00:00:00 CET 2016

Related to JRA-34998

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Browse to an issue
# Right click on a comment's permalink icon
# Click on "Copy link to clipboard"
# Open a new tab/window
# Paste copied URL, press "Enter"

h3. Expected Results

Issue page loads, scrolled to the specific comment.

h3. Actual Results

Issue page loads, specific comment is not in view and URL is rewritten to the bare issue URL.
fields.summary: Pasting a comment's permalink in new browser does not display specific comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to link a Confluence space to a JIRA Project in the "_Pages_" project tab, the "_Searching_" spinning wheel never returns any results. (See attached screenshot)
h3. Environment
Cloud. Affected Version: 1000.98.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have JIRA and Confluence linked
# Go to a JIRA project that isn't already linked to a Confluence space
# Click the "_Pages_" tab on the left
# Click the "_Select a Confluence space_" text box

h3. Expected Results
A list of Confluence spaces should be presented and filtered according to what's typed.
h3. Actual Results
A "_Searching_" message is presented, but it returns nothing.

A "_TypeError: H.spaces is undefined_" is presented in the browser's console (Firefox)

h3.Workaround
Go to the Project Settings, in the "_Summary_" tab scroll down until you find the "_Settings_" section and click the "_Configure Project Links_" link.
fields.summary: Cannot link Confluence space from JIRA's Pages tab

fields.description:
When viewing an issue (example.jira.com/browse/PROJ-1234) I typically will use the up/down keys on the keyboard to scroll the page.  I'll also occasionally use the page up/page down keys or just the spacebar for the same purpose.

Recenly this stopped working unless I click somewhere in the empty space in the large main area of the page (the one that has the vertical scrollbar on the right).  After that, keyboard scrolling works correctly.  But having to use the mouse, either to give focus (I assume) to that part of the page or to the scrollbar is a minor pain and slows down the workflow.

See attached screenshot for info on when I think it stopped working.
fields.summary: Keyboard scrolling/paging on issues no longer working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The behavior of what view the application defaults to when choosing a project is inconsistent and can cause confusion. JIRA should be defaulting to list view, yet it often returns to Detail View, which some users do not want. This appears to be a caching issue, though at this point we are unsure.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select a project and view the list of issues. You will see either the list view, or the issue view.
# Attempt to do this in incognito mode. The view in incognito mode will often be the opposite.

h3. Expected Results
The view should remain consistent through usage, and should always be either list view or issue view.

h3. Actual Results
The view the application defaults to changes, and is not consistent.
 
h3. Notes
I've been able to reproduce this in Chrome,
fields.summary: List View and Issue View Inconsistent in Browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Project picker custom field value is not shown (empty) on Issue Statistic gadget.

h3. Steps to reproduce 

# Create a _Project Picker_ custom field and associate it with a _Screen_
# Have an issue and select any value for _Project Picker_ custom field
# Have a dashboard and add {{Issue Statistic}} gadget
# Select that custom field as *Statistic Type*, Save

h3. Current Result

_Issue Statistic_ gadget shows empty value for _Project Picker_ custom field
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Result

_Issue Statistic_ gadget shows the value (Project's name) for _Project Picker_ custom field
fields.summary: Project picker custom field value is not shown on Issue Statistic gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When generating a export from a JIRA Cloud instance, users that exist in both the Crowd and internal directories will be exported into the backup without their password.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud Instance

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Validate if the instance has users on more than one user directory in the database with the following query:
{code:sql}
select Uinactive.* from cwd_user Uinactive
join cwd_directory Dinactive on Uinactive.directory_id = Dinactive.id
where Dinactive.active = 0 and Uinactive.lower_user_name in (
select lower_user_name from cwd_user Uactive
join cwd_directory Dactive on Uactive.directory_id = Dactive.id
where Dactive.active = 1)
{code}
# Create a backup from the Cloud instance.
# Restore backup into a JIRA Server instance.

h3. Expected Results
Users are able to log in with their credentials.

h3. Actual Results
Users are not able to log in with their credentials. Checking the database, users affected by this have {{nopass}} as their credential.

h3. Workaround
Manually reset the credentials for affected users.
fields.summary: Cloud exports are not bringing user credentials

h3. Current Result.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Logging work on a issue transition creates duplicate "history" entries in the database. The Issue History shows duplicate entries for the transition.
The "Transitions" issue tab displays an incorrect amount of Execution Times.
This affects scripts or plugins using the history to reconstruct status changes.

h3. Environment
 * JIRA Core

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the "Log Work" field to a transition screen.
 # Run the transition on an issue and add some work time.
 # Navigate to the History tab on the issue

h3. Expected Results

Work logged and Status changes show only once.
 The change is only stored once in the database.
h3. Actual Results

The History shows 2 entries with the exact same date and time for the same transition.
 !changelogwork.jpg|width=638,height=226!

The database shows a duplicate entry for the transition in the 'changeitem' table with a time difference of ~0.1 seconds
The Transitions tab shows Execution Times = 2 for that transition.

h3. Notes
Changelog entries can be found for a specific issue with: (replacing <PROJECTKEY> and <ISSUENUM> )
{noformat}
select * from changegroup g left join changeitem i on g.id = i.groupid where issueid = (select id from jiraissue where issuenum = <ISSUENUM> and project = (select id from project where pkey = '<PROJECTKEY>')) order by created asc;

{noformat}
h3. Workaround

To prevent duplicate entries, remove the "Log Work" field from the Screen used in the transition and log work separately using the More (...) -> Log Work option.
fields.summary: Duplicate changelog entries when having "Log Work" field in a Transition Screen

When attempting to play files such as mp4 or mov, JIRA prompts the user to download it instead of previewing it.

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.656.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Click on it

h3. Expected Results
The file should be previewed and the video should be played on browser.

h3. Actual Results
The attachment is downloaded
fields.summary: Attempting to preview videos in JIRA prompt the user to download instead of playing it

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Security Level field doesn't list up any candidates on existing issue's _Edit issue_ page if it's set up to refer to Group custom field value.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud v1000.456.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create _Security Level_ (named "Security Level - 1" here) which refers to _Group Picker_ field (named "Target Group")
 # Make sure there's existing issue in a project (named "FOO-1")
 # Set the Security Scheme to the project and make "Target Group" visible in enabled screen
 # On "FOO-1", check the _Security Level_ field doesn't list up any Security Levels except _None_

h3. Expected Results

The Security Level field lists up the Security Levels configured in Issue Security Scheme.
 In the example above, "Security Level - 1" should be listed as _Create issue_ page does.
h3. Actual Results

The Security Level field only shows "None".
 On the other hand, the Security Level appears as expected on _Create issue_ page.
h3. Workaround
 # Fill groups in _"Target Group"_ and _Update_ once
 # Edit "FOO-1" again
 # Then "Security Level - 1" appears in Security Level field

h3. Notes

Related to this issue, possibly another problem occurs by selecting "Security Level - 1" with leaving the _"Target Group"_ field blank.
 On this case, nobody can access the issue unless JIRA administrator deactivates Security Scheme or adds needed _Users / Groups / Project Roles_ to "Security Level - 1".
fields.summary: Security Level field doesn't list up any candidates in a certain case

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On JIRA Cloud, when the _sysadmin_ user is member of a given group, and this given group is used as a parameter of the _membersOf("")_ function, the whole JQL doesn't work and return an error:
{quote}A value provided by the function 'membersOf' is invalid for the field 'assignee'.{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the sysadmin user to a group (it can be any group)
# Go to the issue navigator advanced search and use the function as follows: {quote}assignee was in membersOf("<group-sysadmin-is-member>"){quote}

h3. Expected Results
JQL returns the issues according to the JQL
h3. Actual Results
No issues are return, and the JQL fails with the error {quote}A value provided by the function 'membersOf' is invalid for the field 'assignee'.{quote}

h3.Workaround
Contact support at https://support.atlassian.com and ask them to remove the sysadmin user from this group.
fields.summary: JQL function membersOf("") doesn't work if the sysadmin user is member of the group given as parameter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Allow unassigned issues in jira general configuration is set to OFF and you have an existing Issue collector the issue collector cannot be modified unless Allow unassigned issues is set to ON, even if the settings are assigning the issue on create.  

The page will continually refresh an no settings are applied

The same applies to creating a new Issue collector as well

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.2.0-OD-05-030
* Issue collector Version: 2.0.13

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Under system >> general Configuration set *Allow unassigned issues: ON*
# [Create an issue collector for a project | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/using-the-issue-collector-776636529.html]
# Under system >> general Configuration set *Allow unassigned issues: OFF*
# Edit the issue collector you made in Step 2 OR try to create an issue collector
# Select Save or Update

h3. Expected Results
Issue collector can be edited or Created, redirecting to the issue collector page

h3. Actual Results
Page refreshes and changes are not applied

h3.Workaround
Set *{{Allow unassigned issues: ON}}*  You will be able to edit the issue collector.  You can set the *{{Allow unassigned issues:}}* back to *OFF* once complete making the changes to the issue collector.
fields.summary: Cannot Edit or create Issue Collector when Allow unassigned issues is set to OFF

fields.description:
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud 1000.824.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export backup from source instance: https://<EXAMPLE>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/ondemandbackupmanager/admin
 # Importing into target instance: https://<EXAMPLE2>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/StudioImportSelect!start.jspa
 # Error:
{code:java}
External directory 'Identity Platform Directory' is not supported. Please change the 'active' attribute to '0' or open a support ticket for more help.{code}

 # JIRA Log Error:
{code:java}
2017-03-21 08:59:51.968045500 java.io.IOException: Could not delete file in Media API; Reason: 'FILE_NOT_FOUND'; Http status code: '404'; Message: '{"error":{"code":"NotFoundError","title":"Resource d63cf8a6-9e0c-4cff-a4af-1580ca5c4cfb requested does not exist","href":"https://media-api-internal.atlassian.io#NotFoundError"}}'
{code}

Cannot proceed without modifying the XML > See workaround below
h3. Expected Results

Migrating from Cloud to Cloud to be possible without the need to modified the entities.xml
h3. Actual Results

When migrating from Cloud to Cloud, JIRA Export contains 2 directories in the entities.xml. This causes the following error to occur when migrating from Cloud to Cloud:
{code:java}
External directory 'Identity Platform Directory' is not supported. Please change the 'active' attribute to '0' or open a support ticket for more help.
 {code}
h3. Workaround

This will not bring our the users from the source instance (example), but it will allow you to import into target instance (example2)

KB: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Importing+from+JIRA+Server+application+to+JIRA+Cloud+application+throws+an+Unsupported+Crowd+Directory+Error]
 # Modifying XML to remove the directory and trying again:

h3. Summary

When receiving email notifications in Service Desk from a user action, if the user uses Gravatar, their avatar will not show in the email.

h3. Environment

JIRA Service Desk Cloud - 3.3.0-OD-1000.259.0

# Upload an avatar to your Gravatar account that is linked to your Atlassian account (http://en.gravatar.com)

Notification should include Gravatar for the user that performed the action.

 !Pasted_Image_05_09_16_12_16.png|thumbnail!

 !Pasted_Image_05_09_16_12_21.png|thumbnail!

Upload the avatar locally in your instance.

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When a customer attempts to create, edit, or transition issues with JIRA, an error is displayed indicating an issue within the workflow. Subsequently the action cannot be carried out.

h3. Environment
Cloud - v1000.350.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt create a new issue
or
# Attempt to transition an issue
or
# Attempt to edit an existing issue

h3. Expected Results
The issue should be created, transitioned to the next workflow step, or updated with the new information input in the edit window

h3. Actual Results
The issue is not created, is not transitioned, is not updated. Instead the below error is displayed:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:ChangeGroup][issue,36800][author,xshi][created,2016-09-19 01:36:21.042][id,248500] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.changegroup (ID, issueid, AUTHOR, CREATED) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_changegroup"))
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:ChangeGroup][issue,36800][author,xshi][created,2016-09-19 01:36:21.042][id,248500] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.changegroup (ID, issueid, AUTHOR, CREATED) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_changegroup")) 
{noformat}
{noformat}Could not move to history step for #37504: root cause: while inserting: [GenericEntity:OSHistoryStep][owner,][caller,fthorp][dueDate,null][stepId,5][actionId,51][finishDate,2016-09-19 08:47:00.781][id,54640][startDate,2016-09-19 08:30:31.383][entryId,37504][status,null] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.OS_HISTORYSTEP (ID, ENTRY_ID, STEP_ID, ACTION_ID, OWNER, START_DATE, DUE_DATE, FINISH_DATE, STATUS, CALLER) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_os_historystep"))
{noformat}

In the place of "pk_os_historystep" you may also see:
* pk_historystep_prev
* pk_changeitem
* pk_changegroup 

h3.Workaround
JIRA Cloud Support is able to run an update against your JIRA database that will resolve the current issue.
fields.summary: Unable to create, edit, or transition issues due to duplicate key value error

h3. Summary

If you add a link that contains a mp4 video to a JIRA issue, you won't be able to load this video by selecting the link via JIRA mobile for IOS, it will open the video player but the option to reproduce it will be disabled.

!jiramobile.PNG|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JIRA issue
 # Add a link that contains a mp4 video on this JIRA issue.
 ** For this specific case, we uploaded a mp4 video in dropbox.com and added the video URL address to the JIRA issue.
 # Open the JIRA issue in your JIRA mobile for IOS.
 # Open the video URL address.

h3. Actual Result
 * It displays a gray box and the video is not loaded.

h3. Expected Result
 * The video will load.

h3. Workaround
 * Copy and paste the URL in your browser.

h3. Summary
When renaming an issue type in the issue type administation page, the same issue type in projects is still displaing to the old name

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud Version: {{7.2.0-OD-05-030}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Issue Types Administration page: https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewIssueTypes.jspa
# Click on _Edit_ to rename _Bug_ issue type to _Buggy_
# Create a new issue and issue types with _Bug_ name will appear

h3. Expected Results
The issue type new name will be updated throughout all projects that are using this issue type

h3. Actual Results
The issue type in the project is still using the old name even though has been renamed

h3. Workaround
Please raise a support request at support.atlassian.com for us to run the fix for you
 
Note: All standard and sub-task issue types are affected including the default issue types in JIRA

fields.description:
a) Let's say that you are Alice and you want to create a Chore for Bob.
b) Create new Chore and on creation page, select Bob as assignee.
c) When you create the chore, assignee is Alice. (Which is not comfortable, but expected, not a subject of this bug.)
d) When you're on a parent page and see the new chore in the list of Sub-Tasks, hover your mouse over the issue and press 'a'.
e) There will be a dialog to change assignee. On the parent page behind the dialog, assignee would be Alice (you), but in the dialog, it will be Bob (this is the bug).
f) If you click Assign, to assign it to Bob, it will tell you, that it can't be done because it's already assigned to Bob (which is not true on any other page than this dialog and it also unexpected behaviour - bug).
g) If you open the chore in new window and change assignee to Bob, it will work.
For example, see attached images. Notice that Chore under number 11. is assigned to Hendrik on the parent page, but in the dialog it says Michael and it can't be assigned to Michael. (It can be assigned to Michael if you open it in the new page and change it, but not in the dialog box.)
fields.summary: Assigning Issue via Dialog Box (pressing 'a') is a Mess

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to activate notifications to an external email in a Jira, it seems to not be notifying the external user. 

 
h3. Environment  
 * JIRA Cloud version 1000.610.1

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 In order to test, and enable the functionality, we would need to pass through the following configuration:
 # Have the *Browse Projects* permission to *Group: Anyone* 
 # Make sure to have the *Notifications* set with the *Issue Created* to *Single Email Address* and make sure to have this email not corresponding to any user in JIRA, since it will be related to an external one.
 # Create a new issue in the project, and the notification will not be sent to the email.

 
h3. Expected Results

 We should have a notification sent for the user, about the issue creation.
h4.  
h3. Actual Results

 No notifications are sent at all.

 
h4. Workaround

 There's no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Non-JIRA User Single Email Address Notification not Working

fields.description:
I'm opening another issue to this same problem since it is happening again with our users.
Previous issue: JRA-31581

We have several customers that collect "common hours" such as vacations and meetings on the same issue for all employees. This means that the history of these issues grows very big (thousands of changes).
We have noticed that adding hours to these issues takes a good deal longer than adding hours to "new" issues (5-10 seconds, sometimes longer). We have tried both the standard "Log work" function and Tempo with the same results.
Experimenting a bit also shows that it looks like the "dispatchEvent" parameter to the "createWorklog" function is the key. Setting the "dispatchEvent" to false makes everything OK. This means that somebody that is listening to the ISSUE_WORKLOGGED_ID event is taking a long time processing.
Note that we disabled all plugins except the Atlassian plugins (see attached screenshot) which means that it's either JIRA itself or some of the listed Atlassian plugins that is the culprit.
fields.summary: Adding worklogs to issues with large histories is very slow

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Atlassian Connect add-ons do not work in Internet Explorer 11 since the last release.

h3. Environment
Tested on JIRA v1000.217.1 - Not working
Tested on JIRA v1000.203.1 - Working

h3. Steps to Reproduce
We can try to use any Atlassian Connect add-ons to test this issue, although I'll point out 2 specific cases:
1) Teamcity add-on:
- Install Teamcity add-on on your Cloud instance
- Go to the project administration of a project, On the board click on the Teamcity option:
 !Screen Shot 2016-08-08 at 5.08.43 PM.png|thumbnail! 

2) Who's Looking:
- Install the Who's Looking add-on
- Open a ticket and observe Who's looking field on the right side panel

h3. Expected Results
Gadgets must work as designed
- Who's looking must show the users looking the issue at the moment
- Teamcity add-on option must be displayed

h3. Actual Results
Who's looking add-on does not load
Teamcity add-on does not load

h3.Workaround
Use other browsers updated like Chrome or Firefox

h3. Summary
Clicking {{Assign}} button on _Issue View screen_ does not set the auto focus to *Assignee* field. 

h3. Steps to reproduce

h3. Current Result
The auto focus is not automatically set to *Assignee* field.

h3. Expected Result
The auto focus is automatically set to *Assignee* field.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*Update Issue Field* post-function: _Remaining estimate will be set to 0_  gets saved twice in issue history, if it is placed first on the list of post functions. As a consequence the equivalent value of Original time estimate for the issue is subtracted twice from Total Remaining Estimate in the Burndown chart

h3. Environment
 Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum Board
# Add post function on the Done transition: _Remaining estimate will be set to 0_
#*  !Remaining estimate set to 0 listed first.png|thumbnail!  
# (Optional: you can add a screen on this transition to Log Work)
# Transition the issue to Done

h3. Expected Results
Setting the Remaining Estimate to 0 is saved once in issue history

h3. Actual Results
Remaining Estimate to 0 is saved twice in issue history
*  !Remaining estimate saved twice.png|thumbnail! 

Consequence of this is that the Remaining Estimate is subtracted twice from the Total Remaining Estimate in the Burndown chart
*  !Burndown Chart information.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
If there is work logged at the same time (using a screen in the transition), this change is ignored by the Burndown chart (it is not subtracted from the Total Remaining Estimate in the Burndown chart)

If there is work logged before the issue is completed, this value is subtracted from the Total Remaining Estimate the Burndown chart, plus when the issue is completed the equivalence of the Original Estimated Value for the issue is subtracted from the Total Remaining Estimate

h3.Workaround

Don't use the post-function _Remaining Estimate will be set to 0_ and at this moment only log work to issues. 

Notes: If the post function is placed at the bottom:
*  !Remaining Estimate will be set to 0 bottom.png|thumbnail! 

Remaining Estimate will be saved once in issue history.

-However, if this is the case, only the actual logged work is subtracted from the Total Remaining Estimate in the Burndown chart and the Remaining time set to 0 is not taken into account (this is reported in JSW-6788)-

For JIRA Cloud, the bug was fixed: JSWCLOUD-6788. So, it will create duplicate work in the Burndown chart.
fields.summary: Update issue field post function gets saved twice in issue history if it is placed first in the list of post functions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Failing to import a large JIRA Server backups into JIRA Cloud. Page unavailable error, JIRA instance is down. 
 Test zip file was 400MB compressed, 2.5 GB uncompressed > No attachments were used

Similar effect occurs when attempting to import a large attachment only zip file into the Cloud instance.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud: 1000.621.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to JIRA Import Wizard: <example>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/StudioImportSelect!start.jspa
 # Click on Begin import
 # Choose .zip file for local computer
 # Uploading Processes: completes with no issues
 # Processing import files: Completes with no issues
 # *Import file successfully processed. You will be redirected to the next step in 5 seconds* > Page loads > Page timeout

h3. Expected Results

For JIRA Server backup to be imported into JIRA Cloud
h3. Actual Results

Little over 1m 20s after "Import file is successfully processed" the import page times out.
{quote}Page unavailable

Your Atlassian Cloud service is currently unavailable. If it’s around midnight it’s likely due to scheduled maintenance, and your page should be available again soon.

If your page hasn’t appeared again in 5-10 minutes, go ahead and create a support request.
 Create a support request
{quote}
JIRA Logs:

Loops parsing activeobjects.xml and entities.xml. This keeps occurring until the JIRA Cloud instance restarts
{code:java}

2017-01-03 17:57:36.751712500 2017-01-03 17:57:36,751 http-nio-2991-exec-1 INFO sysadmin 1073x436x11  4.15.43.214 /secure/admin/StudioImportSelect!selectSingleFile.jspa [c.a.s.j.i.impl.visitor.JiraExportVisitor] Finished parsing activeobjects.xml in 28s
2017-01-03 17:58:33.319635500 2017-01-03 17:58:33,319 http-nio-2991-exec-6 INFO sysadmin 1074x438x11  4.15.43.214 /secure/admin/StudioImportSelect!selectSingleFile.jspa [c.a.s.j.i.impl.visitor.JiraExportVisitor] Finished parsing entities.xml in 232s
{code}
Failed Import Results in brining JIRA Down:
{code:java}
JIRA is HTTPConnectionPool(host='localhost', port=80): Read timed out. (read timeout=10)
{code}
h3. Notes

This was done with JIRA Server data only, attachment were left out. However, this behavior has been observed when attempting to import large attachment only zip files into the Cloud instance
h3. Workaround

Please contact Support to restart instance

fields.summary: Versions in Business projects cannot be viewed, return 404 error instead

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

JIRA dashboards and Agile boards are working,  but the when an individual issues is clicked the details of that issue do not show up.
!jira.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Diagnosis

The following error can be seen in application  logs:
{code}
2016-02-08 12:00:46,019 http-nio-2990-exec-101 ERROR sysadmin 720x15805x1 dr086e 103.233.242.8,10.129.1.152,127.0.0.1 /browse/ITSM-1854 [c.a.plugin.web.DefaultWebInterfaceManager] Could not evaluate condition 'com.gliffy.plugin.jira.web.conditions.ShowAddEditGliffyDiagramItemCondition@28b84e' for descriptor: com.gliffy.integration.jira:add-gliffy-diagram-web-item (Add Gliffy Diagram Web Item)
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class com.atlassian.upm.osgi.impl.Versions
	at com.atlassian.upm.license.storage.lib.VersionChecker.isUpmVersionEqualToOrAfter(VersionChecker.java:66)
....
{code}

h3. Analysis

This issue was introduced by the 7.1-OD-06 release of JIRA Cloud. It was caused by an older version of the Gliffy plugin remaining in the JIRA's installed plugins directory when it was no longer needed for a subset of instances. Affected instances have been identified and the outdated plugin removed from the installation. This should resolve the issue for all customers.
fields.summary: JIRA issue details are not visible

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pivotal Epics are not imported into JIRA.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud: 1000.571.1
JIRA Software Application: 1000.0.0-D20160616T023228


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project in Pivotal, some stories and one epic
# Add some stories, a description and one or more attachments to the epic
# In JIRA create a Software project. Make sure that the epic issue type is available (so, choose either Scrum or Kanban)
# Go to *External System Import* and import the Pivotal project from step #1 into the JIRA project from previous step 


h3. Expected Results
The epic is correctly imported 

h3. Actual Results
The epic is not imported. No errors in the logs (and no mention about importing epics as well)
 
h3. Workaround
Export and import as CSV.
fields.summary: Pivotal Epics are not imported into JIRA Software projects

	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:15)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:458)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:426)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:216)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This issue has the same root-cause of JRA-46227

h3. Workaround
Projects created by Trello importer are using Default Issue Type Scheme. Import requires at least one task issue type and one subtask issue type to be defined in default issue type scheme. Subtask issue type is also recommended to import check-list. More details on defining issue types: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ADMINJIRASERVER071/Defining+issue+type+field+values

Because of JRA-46227 it can be the case that Task and Sub-Task issue types are not defined in the Default Issue Type Scheme. In this case you can proceed as follows:

* JIRA Server
Follow the instructions in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Unable+to+move+issue+to+another+Issue+Type+due+to+%27The+issue+type+selected+is+invalid%27+error] to add the issue types to the scheme

* JIRA Cloud
Open a support ticket at [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com] to have those issue types added.
fields.summary: Cannot import Trello board on JIRA Core (No valid issue type error)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Trying to choose date of month May using the Date Picker on Date Picket type Custom Field will prompt you a warning as the following:-

  Вы не ввели верную дату. Пожалуйста, введите дату в формате "d/MMM/yy", например. "17/фев/17"

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set profile language to *Russian*
 # Create issue and insert *Due Date* for May

h3. Expected Results

Able to create the issue.
h3. Actual Results

Error thrown and can't create issue.
h3. Workaround
 * Manually add the month name as {{мая}} instead of {{май}}
fields.summary: Date picker for Russian Language for month of "May"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Email Filter Subscriptions are still sent after an user is marked as deactivated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA user.
# Log in as this user.
# Create a filter.
#* Filter used: issuekey in issueHistory() ORDER BY lastViewed DESC
#* Ticked the option to still send an email even there's no issue found.
# Subscribe to the filter.
# Deactivate the user.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA sends subscription notifications to active JIRA users.

h3. Actual Results
Deactivated users still receive email from the filter subscription. 

h3.Workaround
The documentation mentioned in JRA-23462 is not accessible. Will update if there is any updated workaround available.
fields.summary: Deactivated users still receive emails from filter subscriptions
